author: andschwa
body:
<!--
Before submitting this pull request, please first:

- [ ] State that it "Resolves #xyz".
- [ ] Ensure your code is up-to-date with `master`.
- [ ] Add tests that fail without your changes.
- [ ] Update all relevant [documentation](../docs).
- [ ] Assign the PR to the appropriate subsystem [maintainer](https://aka.ms/psowners).
- [ ] Check that your commits follow our [contributing guidelines](CONTRIBUTING.md)
-->

This resolves #1100.

@vors what file could we not exclude with a guard, was it #670 `ControlPanelItemCommand.cs` or `GetComputerInfoCommand.cs`?

@lzybkr I believe this also restores the BOMs that were overwritten with the original addition of the CORECLR guards.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @vors I think we'd probably want to attempt some globbing of the excluded files, as it's a straight list right now; but we should do this while identifying if/where we want to move the files (i.e. separate from this PR).

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: Also, the schema is apparently unclear on if `buildOptions` should merge or not (see https://github.com/dotnet/cli/issues/3577), worked around current behavior by duplication.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: I spot-checked; the BOMs are being identified correctly.

title: Remove CORECLR guards
